benchmark_details.name: EgoGazeVQA (Egocentric Gaze-Guided Video Question Answering)
benchmark_details.overview: EgoGazeVQA is an egocentric gaze-guided video question answering benchmark designed to evaluate the ability of existing MLLMs to interpret user intentions from first-person videos by leveraging gaze information.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess whether MLLMs can utilize egocentric gaze signals for analyzing daily-routine videos.

data.source: Constructed from egocentric video clips sourced from Ego4D, EgoExo4D, and EGTEA Gaze+ with gaze tracking data.
data.annotation: Generated using MLLMs and refined by human annotators for relevance, answerability, fluency, accuracy, conciseness, and difficulty.

methodology.calculation: The performance is assessed by comparing model predictions to ground truth labels.
methodology.interpretation: A higher accuracy percentage indicates better performance in understanding user intentions.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline performance of various MLLMs on EgoGazeVQA includes a maximum accuracy of 60.5% for Qwen2.5-VL-72B.
methodology.validation: Models were evaluated on their ability to leverage gaze information in question-answering tasks.
